moves.1. e4: This was a standard game between two low-ranked players.
moves.1... e5 2. Bc4 Qh4: An unusual (and doubtful) move. The only threat is Qxe4, which I easily blocked.
moves.3. d3: A better defence might have been Nc3, developing a piece.
moves.3... c6: Another eclectic move, which opens up no more space for black. If it was meant in a long-term defensive way, guarding against a push through the centre at d5, why play the queen so strangely?
moves.4. Nc3 Bc5 5. Nf3: This, of course, allows Qxf2#. I had prepared Be3 as a response to Bc5, but forgot to play it! I would deserved to lose here, but luckily for me black missed the opportunity.
moves.6... b5: A reasonable move, pushing forwards and forcing me to defend.
moves.8. a4: My intention was to continue 8... bxa4 9 Nxa4, attacking c5 and preserving good development. At all costs I wanted to prevent 8... a4, trapping my bishop.
moves.8... b4: A clever move, keeping up pressure on white's queen-side and forcing the knight to retreat.
moves.9. Ne2 d5 10. exd5: Black's pawn storm was pushing me further and further back. I chose this moment to blunt his advance without sacrificing material.
moves.10... Qg6: Black had been playing better since a strange first few moves, but here he slipped again, allowing me to win a pawn.
moves.11. dxc6 Nxc6 12. Bd5 Bb7 13. Nxe5: 13... Nxe5 14 Bxb7, winning another pawn. Of course, the Ne5 also threatens the black queen.
Building up towards a pin or discovered check along the e-file.
moves.18. Bc6+: This was exactly the move I had hoped to be able to play. The black queen is now lost.
moves.18... Kd8 19. Bxd7 Kxd7 20. Qxg4+: Forking g7, threatening to win the rook on h8.
moves.20... Kc7 21. Nd5+: 21... Kc6/d6 22 Qxg7, and black cannot take the knight without losing a rook.
moves.26. Qd5+ Kc7 27. Bf4+: At this point, I had a clear lead in both material and position. In the rest of the game I simply forced black's king further and further back to try and mate him.
moves.30... Ka8 31. Qa6#: Thank you for reading my annotation. Comments are welcome.
